title: How to Uninstall Razer Synapse on PC or Mac

steps.title: Close Razer Synapse.
steps.content: Close Razer Synapse. It's a green icon that resembles a cloud in the bottom-right corner of the system tray. Right-click the Razer Synapse icon (click ∧ first if it's not visible). Click Close Razer Synapse .

steps.title: Uninstall Razer Synapse.
steps.content: Uninstall Razer Synapse. You can uninstall Razer Synapse using the Uninstall file in the Razer Synapse directory, or use the following steps. Open Start . Click Settings . Click Apps . Scroll down and select Razer Synapse . Click Uninstall . Click Uninstall to confirm.

steps.title: Restart your computer.
steps.content: Restart your computer. If Razer Synapse is no longer on your computer, stop right here. If it continues to be a problem, there may still be some remnants of it in your registry. Backup your files and continue with the next steps. [2] X Research source Use the following steps to restart your computer. Click Start . Click the Power icon . Click Restart .

steps.title: Launch the Registry Editor app.
steps.content: Launch the Registry Editor app. It's the app that has an icon of blue cubes. Use the following steps to launch the Registry editor. Click Start . Type regedit . Click the Registry Editor app.

steps.title: Click Computer.
steps.content: Click Computer . It's at the top of the registry editor sidebar on the left.

steps.title: Click Edit.
steps.content: Click Edit . It's the second option in the menu bar at the top.

steps.title: Click Find.
steps.content: Click Find . It's in the edit menu. This will open a search bar.

steps.title: Type Razer in the search bar and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type Razer in the search bar and press ↵ Enter . This will search for any items from Razer.

steps.title: Right-click any items from Razer.
steps.content: Right-click any items from Razer. They will say "Razer inc" in the data column.

steps.title: Click Delete.
steps.content: Click Delete . This will delete the registry item. Warning: Be careful what you delete from the registry. Deleting the wrong items can cause your system to not function properly.

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . The icon that resembles a folder in the taskbar is the File Explorer.

steps.title: Click This PC.
steps.content: Click This PC . This will open your root menu on your computer.

steps.title: Type Razer in the search bar and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type Razer in the search bar and press ↵ Enter . The search bar is in the upper-right corner of the File Explorer. This will search for any remaining items from Razer on your computer. The search may take a few minutes.

steps.title: Select all items.
steps.content: Select all items. Hold ⇧ Shift and click to select more than one item.

steps.title: Drag items to the recycling bin.
steps.content: Drag items to the recycling bin. The recycling bin is in the upper-left corner of your Desktop. This will delete all remaining Razer items.

steps.title: Open Finder .
steps.content: Open Finder . The Finder is the app that has an blue and white image with a smiley face.

steps.title: Click Go.
steps.content: Click Go . It's in the menu bar at the top of the screen. This opens a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Utilities.
steps.content: Click Utilities . This will open your system Utilities.

steps.title: Double-click Terminal .
steps.content: Double-click Terminal . It's the app with the icon a black screen with a text cursor in its top-left corner. This will launch the Terminal window on your Mac.

steps.title: Type several commands to delete the Razer files and directories.
steps.content: Type several commands to delete the Razer files and directories. Enter each command into terminal and press ⏎ Return after each line. You may prompted to enter your administrator password to continue. launchctl remove com.razer.rzupdater launchctl remove com.razerzone.rzdeviceengine sudo rm /Library/LaunchAgents/com.razer.rzupdater.plist sudo rm /Library/LaunchAgents/com.razerzone.rzdeviceengine.plist

steps.title: Open Finder .
steps.content: Open Finder . This will return you to the Finder.

steps.title: Click Applications.
steps.content: Click Applications . You can click Applications in the left sidebar, or in the "Go" menu.

steps.title: Drag Razer Synapse to the trash.
steps.content: Drag Razer Synapse to the trash. This will uninstall Razer Synapse.

steps.title: Return to your Terminal window.
steps.content: Return to your Terminal window. You should still have the terminal window open, but if not, you can re-open it just as before.

steps.title: Type the following lines in the terminal.
steps.content: Type the following lines in the terminal. This will remove the support folders for Razer Synapse. [3] X Research source sudo rm -rf /Library/Application\ Support/Razer/ rm -rf ~/Library/Application\ Support/Razer/
